urls.title: Guest blog - How nature dies by Alistair Gammell - Mark Avery
urls.description: Alistair Gammell worked for RSPB for 40 years and was closely involved in the drafting of the Birds and Habitats Directives and for growing RSPB’s international work. He was RSPB’s first International Director and retired from RSPB in 2009. He then worked to successfully establish large scale fully protected marine reserves in the seas around the British Indian Ocean Territory and Pitcairn Island. He is a passionate nature conservationist and fly fisherman (alistairgammell@yahoo.co.uk) Oughton Head is a
